question.title: Excel Equivalent of a Decimal Number
question.content:
Given a positive number 'N'. Your task is to find the Excel Equivalent of the number 'N'.

Note:

1. The Excel equivalent of 1 is "A", the Excel equivalent of 2 is "B" ……………, the Excel equivalent of 26 is "Z". 

2. The Excel equivalent of 27,28…,52 is "AA", "AB"…."AZ" respectively.

3. The Excel Equivalent of 53,54….78 is "BA", "BB"….."BZ".

4. The pattern shown above can be used to find the excel equivalent of any positive number.

5. There is only one Excel Equivalent for a given positive number.
Input format:
The first line of input contains an integer ‘T’ denoting the number of test cases.

The first and only line of each test case contains a number 'N' of which the Excel Equivalent is required to be found.
Output format:
For each test case, return the Excel equivalent of a given number in a separate line.
Note:
You don't need to print anything, it has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Follow Up:
Can you solve this in logarithmic time and space complexity?
Constraints:
1 <= T <= 1000
1 <= N <= 10^15

Time limit: 1sec
Sample Input 1:
2
2
9
Sample Output 1:
B
I
Explanation of Sample Output 1:
In test case 1, the Excel Equivalent of 2 is B.

In test case 2, the Excel Equivalent of 9 is I.
Sample Input 2:
2 
27
31
Sample Output 2:
AA
AE
Explanation of Sample Output 2:
In test case 1, the Excel equivalent of 26 is Z and therefore the Excel equivalent of 27 is AA.

In test case 2, the Excel equivalent of 27 is AA and therefore the Excel equivalent of 31 will be AE.

rephrased.body: Given a positive integer `n`, your task is to convert it into its Excel column title equivalent. For example, 1 corresponds to 'A', 2 to 'B', 26 to 'Z', 27 to 'AA', 28 to 'AB', and so on. The excel equivalent of 1 is "A", the excel equivalent of 2 is "B" ……………, the excel equivalent of 26 is "Z". The excel equivalent of 27,28…,52 is "AA", "AB"…."AZ" respectively. The excel Equivalent of 53,54….78 is "BA", "BB"….."BZ". The pattern shown above can be used to find the excel equivalent of any positive number. There is only one Excel Equivalent for a given positive number.

testcases.explanation: The Excel Equivalent of 2 is B.
The Excel Equivalent of 9 is I.
The Excel equivalent of 26 is Z and therefore the Excel equivalent of 27 is AA.
The Excel equivalent of 27 is AA and therefore the Excel equivalent of 31 will be AE.
The 52nd value in the sequence is AZ.
The 53rd value in the sequence is BA.
The 702 value in the sequence is ZZ.
The 703 value in the sequence is AAA.

hints: Try to think of finding out Excel equivalent of ‘N’ from Excel equivalent of ‘N’ - 1
Try to think of an approach similar to finding the binary representation of a decimal number.
